intro: Mitrasacme paradoxa, commonly known as the paradoxical mitrasacme, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and have a velvety texture. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
